diagnosis.primary: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma (IDC) of the Left Breast
diagnosis.receptorStatus: ER Negative, PR Negative, HER2 Positive (IHC 3+)
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Lumpectomy + SLNB (01/25/2025) followed by Completion Axillary Lymph Node Dissection (ALND) (02/05/2025). Completed adjuvant AC-THP chemotherapy.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) - Breast + Regional Nodes
treatmentPlan.rtRxDetails: 50 Gy / 25 fx to Breast/SCV, followed by sequential Boost of 10 Gy / 5 fx to lumpectomy cavity
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing Left Breast + Left Supraclavicular Fossa (+/- Axillary levels).
medications: Topical Steroid Cream/Aquaphor PRN skin reaction (Breast/Axilla/Neck)
Monitor for lymphedema - Lymphedema precautions reviewed.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine on breast board/wing board with both arms up. Head turned to contralateral side. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter(s). Wires on surgical scars and breast borders for delineation.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired post-chemotherapy for adjuvant 3D-CRT planning of breast and supraclavicular region. Split isocenter setup used.

dosimetry.collAngles: Variable (to match tangent divergence and SCV)
dosimetry.constraints: Heart Mean < 5 Gy; Ips Lng V20Gy < 30%; Brachial Plex Max < 60 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Breast + SCV 3D plan post-chemo. Fields matched at junction. Boost to be planned sequentially.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily kV imaging for setup verification. Match to chest wall and SCV alignment.
fractions.sideEffects: Mild erythema (Grade 1) in axilla and SCV regions.
fractions.notes: Patient tolerating well. Skin care instructions reinforced.

imagingAndReports.summary: 3cm irregular mass L breast central, suspicious axillary node. BI-RADS 5.
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Grade 3. ER/PR neg, HER2 IHC 3+.
No evidence of distant metastatic disease. Confirmed suspicious L axillary nodes.
3.5 cm IDC, Gr 3. Margins neg. 2/3 SN positive. ER/PR-, HER2+.
Additional 0/12 nodes positive. Total 2/15 nodes positive (pN1a).
CT acquired post-chemo for 3D-CRT planning of breast + SCV region.

labResults.notes: Counts recovering post-chemo. Adequate for RT.
Baseline cardiac function stable during Herceptin tx. OK to proceed with RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Helen Carter (Surgeon)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ new dx L BC, HER2+. Biopsy confirms IDC Gr 3. Plan for Lumpectomy + SLNB. If SN+, will need ALND. Discussed neoadjuvant vs adjuvant chemo w/ Med Onc. Pt prefers surgery first.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Richard Lee (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p Lump/ALND for pT2pN1a HER2+ BC. Recommend adjuvant AC-THP chemo x 6 cycles, followed by RT, continue HP for 1 yr total. Discussed chemo/HP toxicities. Pt agrees. Port placed. Start chemo next week.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Richard Lee (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 6 cycles AC-THP. Tolerated reasonably well w/ expected side effects. Continue HP infusions q3wks. Refer back to Rad Onc for adjuvant RT planning. Last ECHO LVEF stable.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p Lump/ALND/Chemo for pT2pN1a HER2+ L BC. Plan for adjuvant RT to L Breast + SCV fossa to 50Gy/25fx followed by 10Gy/5fx boost. Discussed RT fields/setup, side effects (skin rxn, fatigue, lymphedema risk, low risk pneumonitis/cardiac). Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled. Continue HP during RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 10/25 fx. Mild erythema breast/axilla/neck (Gr 1). No lymphedema noted. Tolerating well. Continue RT. Skin care reviewed.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant radiation to the breast and regional lymph nodes (supraclavicular) to reduce the risk of recurrence.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Skin reaction (redness, peeling, soreness) in breast, axilla, and lower neck; fatigue; potential mild esophagitis (sore throat). Late: Lymphedema risk (arm swelling), breast texture changes, low risk of cardiac/lung effects or brachial plexus injury.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Lymphedema precautions (avoid BP cuffs, needle sticks on left arm). Skin care (moisturizers, avoid irritants). Reporting arm/hand swelling, significant skin breakdown, or pain.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, perform skin care, monitor for lymphedema, report symptoms.

cptCharges.description: Radiation treatment delivery, 3+ fields / complex (Tangents + SCV field +/- PAB)
Special treatment procedure (May apply for boost planning/delivery or complex setup)
Chemo admin, Init/Addtl hr HER2 agent infusion
